sentences.english: This is not to say that the blind belief of sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 這並非是說，對於濫情的盲目相信。

sentences.english: Can no longer be such to be saved, for students.
sentences.chinese: 能不能不再這樣，以濫情爲存生。

sentences.english: Bloom is a true emotional spendthrift who uses his feelings lavishly.
sentences.chinese: 布盧姆是個真正的濫情者。

sentences.english: Middle aged Simpson hasn't got married yet as he likes playing the field.
sentences.chinese: 辛普森過於濫情，人到中年還沒結婚。

sentences.english: But because of ignorant overflows the sentiment. Because ignorant only then is injured.
sentences.chinese: 因爲愚昧而去濫情因爲懵懂纔去受傷。

sentences.english: But I know who these gushing with feelings, no one is not empty.
sentences.chinese: 但我所瞭解的這些濫情者，沒有一個是不空虛的。

sentences.english: I am a great respect for the feelings of the people, but emotions do not spread.
sentences.chinese: 我是個非常尊重感情的人，但是不濫情。

sentences.english: People are far more promiscuous, it seems, on foreign holidays.
sentences.chinese: 在外國度假時，人們似乎會很更濫情。

definition: to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
hard to deal with/hard to get along with
lit. to like the new, and hate the old (idiom); fig. enamored with new people (e.g. new girlfriend), bored with the old
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
